caseTitle: Khan Bahadar Khan v. Khan Malook Khan
tagline: The proceedings before the revisional Court are to ensure strict adherence to safe administration of justice. In a fit case, the exercise of suo motu jurisdiction may not be conveniently avoided or overlooked. The revision application on application or laying information cannot be left opened without rigors of limitation period that will be against the doctrine of finality. The Court may exercise suo motu jurisdiction under Section 115 C.P.C if the conditions are satisfied which is meant to cure and rectify serious illegality or irregularity.
